fields.name: nucleusBanner
fields.description: Service which holds the array of banner items

fields.name: _isShowMore
fields.description: Show/hide the number of stacked notifications

fields.name: isFixed
fields.description: Flag to toggle the position of the banner between absolute & fixed.

fields.name: showMoreLabel
fields.description: Button Label that describes the presence of multiple banners

fields.name: stackTitle
fields.description: Title text that describes the stack of multiple banners

fields.name: bannerItems
fields.description: List of banner items to be rendered.

methods.name: toggleShowMore
methods.description: Toggle action to show or hide the stacked notifications.

methods.name: deleteItem
methods.description: Action that gets invoked on clicking the close button.

fields.name: bannerItem
fields.description:
Banner item

{
  title: 'title',
  type: 'success',
  isDismissible: true,
  content: {
    linkAction: this.someAction.bind(this),
    linkText: 'Click here'
  },
  componentName: 'some-component-name',
  componentProps: {}
}

methods.name: onClose
methods.description: Closure action that gets invoked on clicking the close button.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Class name active added if set to true

fields.name: block
fields.description: Flag to set button as full width block.

fields.name: iconOnly
fields.description: Specifies it is an icon-only button

fields.name: customClass
fields.description: Custom class names to be added to the button.

fields.name: labelTimeout
fields.description: Timeout after which the default label replaces fulfilled/rejected label.

fields.name: _isShowLoading
fields.description: Show loading animation only if custom state labels are not specified

fields.name: pendingLabel
fields.description: Label to be displayed during Promise pending state

fields.name: successLabel
fields.description: Label to be displayed during Promise fulfilled state, a.k.a success label

fields.name: failureLabel
fields.description: Label to be displayed during Promise rejected state, a.k.a failure label

fields.name: isDismissible
fields.description: Show or hide the close button

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the banner. Can be plain text or HTML.

methods.name: onClose
methods.description: Closure action that gets invoked on clicking the close button.

methods.name: onCloseTip
methods.description: The action that gets invoked on clicking the close button.

component:Components.@freshworks/modal/c.title: Nucleus Confirm Dialog
component:Components.@freshworks/modal/c.text: Usage: Refer component page Furthermore references to the following actions are yielded:  close: triggers the onClose action and closes the modal submit: triggers the onSubmit action

attributes.name: Nucleus Confirm Dialog
attributes.description:
Usage: Refer component page

Furthermore references to the following actions are yielded:

  • close: triggers the onClose action and closes the modal
  • submit: triggers the onSubmit action

fields.name: size
fields.description: Size of the dialog, defaults to small

component:Components.@freshworks/modal/c.title: Nucleus Modal
component:Components.@freshworks/modal/c.text: Usage: Refer component page The component yields references to the following contextual components, that you can use to further customize the output:  modal.body modal.header modal.footer  Furthermore references to the following actions are yielded:  close: triggers the onClose action and closes the modal submit: triggers the onSubmit action

attributes.name: Nucleus Modal
attributes.description:
Usage: Refer component page

The component yields references to the following contextual components, that you can use to further customize the output:

  • modal.body
  • modal.header
  • modal.footer

Furthermore references to the following actions are yielded:

  • close: triggers the onClose action and closes the modal
  • submit: triggers the onSubmit action

fields.name: _isOpen
fields.description: Private flag to prevent multiple show/hide calls

fields.name: backdrop
fields.description: Flag to show or hide the translucent backdrop.

fields.name: isDismissible
fields.description: Flag to enable or disable dismiss option. false hides the close button and disables close on Escape.

fields.name: renderInPlace
fields.description: Render the Modal markup in-place (true) or in wormhole (false)

methods.name: getSetTitleID
methods.description: Gets or sets the id of the title element for aria accessibility tags

template:application-tailwind.title: Your Tailwind styles
template:application-tailwind.text: Your Tailwind styles A reference for every generated class in your app.

template:docs/components/nucleus-banner.title: Banner
template:docs/components/nucleus-banner.text: Banner yarn add @freshworks/banner Banners display information at the top of the screen and alert the user about effects on further usage of the product due to a particular activity, functionality or product-wide status information. Usage Add {{nucleus-banner}} to your application.hbs. 1. Simple banners: 2. Custom component banners: This makes use of the component helper, allowing the template that ultimately renders the banner to be dynamic: Guidelines ✅Do's When more than one notification, use inline messages instead stacking multiple banners (Refer the image above) 🚫Dont's Don’t use banners for success messages. Refer notifications section for such scenarios.

template:docs/components/nucleus-button.title: Button
template:docs/components/nucleus-button.text: Button yarn add @freshworks/button Buttons are interactive components that the users can click or touch to trigger corresponding business logic. Usage 1. Simplest use case A button with text in it, telling the user what to do. 2. Block form Button with yieldable content. Some yield content here 3. Asynchronous Button Dynamic button which has different states: pending and success. Supply an action that returns a Promise and watch the magic! Styles 1. Different variants: 2. Different sizes: 3. Icon buttons: It is possible to create buttons that contain only icons with the iconOnly attribute. The iconSize property specifies the size of the icon. If the iconSize is not mentioned, the icon takes the size of the button. 4. Full-width button: 5. Disabled button To toggle the 'disabled' property, set 'disabled' to true Guidelines ✅Do's Label button with what action it triggers Choose appropriate button for the context Use primary button for the primary/important action of the page. Use secondary buttons as default buttons Use link buttons as tertiary buttons for less prominent actions Use consistent button placement and direction for a user journey Use button against a contrast background and have essential white space around the button 🚫Dont's Avoid using too many buttons in one page Button copy shouldn’t be too wordy Don’t use more than one primary button in a page Don’t use buttons instead of tabs Don’t trigger the action without alerting the user for destructive buttons Don’t use destructive buttons for all delete/ cancellation scenarios. More applicable for actions which involves deleting the data permanently Don’t enable primary button before all mandatory fields are filled Accessibility Since we're using the native HTML button element and requiring a label value to be provided, the component itself is accesible as it is. If you are going to put an icon in the button, then you will need to set an aria-label property on the button: 🐹

template:docs/components/nucleus-inline-.title: Inline Banner
template:docs/components/nucleus-inline-.text: Inline Banner yarn add @freshworks/inline-banner Inline messages are those which stay in the screen for a limited period of time and leave with no or minimal user interaction. It provides additional information to the context of the page. Usage 1. Simple use case 2. Custom content Guidelines ✅Do's When used in a form, in-line messages are used at the bottom before the CTA button. However, based on the content, it can be placed above as well. Follow the character limit guidelines mentioned in Typography. 🚫Dont's Do not include buttons in an in-line message. Do not include many user interactions in an in-line message. Do not block the user flow. It should only be a notification component and not ask for mandatory user interactions.

template:docs/components/nucleus-modal.title: Modal
template:docs/components/nucleus-modal.text: Modal yarn add @freshworks/modal Best use of modals is to get the task quickly done and may also support in completion of the primary task, for example: Creation of an entity and also editing it. Modal has to be relevant and carefully utilized as modal grasp users attention and may obstruct their current flow. Usage 1. Simple Modal 2. Confirm Dialog 3. Slider Guidelines ✅Do's Add scroll to body (CTA to remain fixed) incase the content is more. Icon to the titles has to be contextual Focus should be on the first item in modal as it opens 🚫Dont's Don’t exceed maximum width of 800 px Avoid using 2 levels of modal on modal. Don’t use modal if it is not related to the user’s current taskflow. Avoid modal for complex decision making that requires additional sources of information. Avoid closing the modal on clicking outside for confirmation modals and forms dialogs in which user confirmation or input required. Keyboard Support Tab Moves focus to next focusable element inside the dialog. When focus is on the last focusable element in the dialog, moves focus to the first focusable element in the dialog. Shift + Tab Moves focus to previous focusable element inside the dialog. When focus is on the first focusable element in the dialog, moves focus to the last focusable element in the dialog. Escape Closes the dialog. Accessibility role=dialog Identifies the element that serves as the dialog container. aria-labelledby=IDREF Gives the dialog an accessible name by referring to the element that provides the dialog title. aria-describedby=IDREF (optional) Gives the dialog an accessible description by referring to the dialog content that describes the primary message or purpose of the dialog. aria-modal=true Tells assistive technologies that the windows underneath the current dialog are not available for interaction (inert).

template:docs/components/nucleus-toast-m.title: Toast Message
template:docs/components/nucleus-toast-m.text: Toast Message yarn add @freshworks/toast-message Use toast messages for confirmation of delete actions, creating new objects (eg. tickets, groups) etc. Toast messages are used so that they don’t completely disrupt the user’s workflow but alert them anyway. Usage Add {{nucleus-toast-message}} to your application.hbs. Guidelines ✅Do's Keep the message short and to the point Icon to the titles has to be contextual 🚫Dont's Don’t have more than two lines of content Don’t use toast messages on overlays (sliders/modals) Don’t use toast messages for high priority information

template:docs/foundation/nucleus-icon.title: Icon
template:docs/foundation/nucleus-icon.text: Icon yarn add @freshworks/icon Usage List of icons

template:docs/index.title: Introduction
template:docs/index.text: Introduction Nucleus is a component library for Freshworks built as an Ember addon based on the unified design language called the Freshworks DSM proposed by the design team. It helps us to consolidate our UI patterns and components with all the bells and whistles to provide a consistent and cohesive UX across all our products.

template:docs/usage.title: Usage
template:docs/usage.text: Usage Requirements node 8 and above ember-cli 3.7 and above Installation Installing Homebrew on Mac Follow the steps on Homebrew Installing node via Homebrew To install node 8: brew install node@8 To install latest node: brew install node Installing ember-cli To install ember-cli globally you must do the following: npm install -g ember-cli Installing nucleus To use Nucleus in your projects, you need to ember install nucleus

template:index.title: Welcome to Freshdesk Design system
template:index.text: Welcome to Freshdesk Design system This system was established to set best practices, to improve UI consistency and to increase the efficiency of the design & development process.
